text: Yngve Aarseth sees deeper than sight, his blood-soaked visions foretelling doom with chilling certainty.
When Aarseth proclaims the coming of a great storm, wise men take shelter, for he is never wrong.
Spirits of the fallen whisper their secrets to him, guiding his hand in matters of war and prophecy.
No secret is hidden from Aarseth; he glimpses the strands of fate and whispers truths no mortal should know.
Though eyeless, his gaze burns into the soul, revealing hidden fears and buried guilt.
He speaks not in riddles but in certainty, guiding warbands toward victory—or destruction.
When he speaks of death, even the mightiest jarls shudder, for his visions always come to pass.
His touch alone can mark a warrior for greatness… or curse them to an early grave.
Beasts do not attack him; they recognize a kinship deeper than speech, yielding to his presence.
In the Land of the Blind
Yngve Aarseth is a feared seer, his blind gaze piercing fate itself, his blood-soaked visions foretelling doom with eerie certainty.

Yngve Aarseth is an enigma wrapped in fear and prophecy. His blind gaze pierces deeper than sight, unraveling fates with chilling certainty, while his blood-soaked visions have doomed warriors before they even set foot on the battlefield
Like a weaver plucking at a frayed cord, Aarseth names the moment a warrior's fate is cut, sending shivers through their ranks.

A weathered banner, blessed by Urska, the shaman of the Seafarer’s Shrine. Those who offer her a feast or silver are granted visions from the deep—cryptic whispers of coming storms, lost treasures, or unseen dangers lurking beyond the horizon.
Marauder mobs are awarded even greater mobility when riding their crude chariots of bone and wood, lashed together with the guts and sinew of the vanquished.

The horses of Norsca live for battle, even choosing to graze on the bones of the fallen over grass.

The winds of Norsca carry whispers of fate, and Yngve Aarseth, the blind prophet, has spoken: 'Gather the voices of the storm, and I shall walk with thee.' He cares not for steel, only for those who see beyond the veil.
Scrawled in blood and ash, Aarseth’s foretelling leaves no doubt—death approaches, and the weak-willed falter before its shadow.
A tattered and old Manticore summoned by the foul whispers uttered by Yngve during one of his many rituals.

Your ancestors howl for vengeance. The Hall of the Snaegr lies defiled, its gates broken by Skaeling hands. Egil Styrbjorn squats where only blood-bound kin should stand. This shame cannot go unanswered — not if you are to ascend. Raise your axe. Reclaim your legacy. Let the bones of pretenders litter the threshold.
